thread.title: Madeleine McCann's parents 'considering legal action after controversial Portuguese documentary appears on YouTube' - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Madeleine McCann's parents 'considering legal action after controversial Portuguese documentary appears on YouTube' - Mirror Online

author: Steve Robson
title: Madeleine McCann's parents 'considering legal action after controversial Portuguese documentary appears on YouTube' - Mirror Online
text:
News Madeleine McCann's parents 'considering legal action after controversial Portuguese documentary appears on YouTube' The who show was made to accompany ex-police chief Goncalo Amaral's book claiming Kate and Gerry were responsible for covering up Madeleine’s “death” in May 2007 Share Madeleine McCann disappeared in 2007 (Photo: PA) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The parents of Madeleine McCann are said to be considering legal action after a controversial TV documentary about her disappearance surfaced on YouTube. 
The show was made to accompany ex-police chief Goncalo Amaral's book claiming Kate and Gerry were responsible for covering up Madeleine’s “death” in May 2007. 
Both the book and the documentary were barred after the McCanns launched a successful libel lawsuit in Portugal. Kate and Gerry McCann (Photo: AFP) Goncalo Amaral features in the controversial documentary (Photo: Collect Unknown) 
But Amaral, 57, has continued to fight the couple and Portugal's Supreme Court sided with him. 
After the ruling was overturned, the book and the TV show are back in circulation. 
The documentary, which features Amaral repeating his claims about the McCanns, has now appeared on YouTube with an English voiceover. The McCanns are considering legal action after the show appeared on YouTube (Photo: Collect Unknown) 
According to the Daily Star, the McCanns have enlisted the help of specialist libel firm Carter Ruck. 
The couple's spokesman told the Star: "Any potentially defamatory material found online will be reviewed and assessed by Kate and Gerry’s lawyers." 
Amaral is currently believed to be in Switzerland putting the finishing touches to a sequel to his first book about the case. 
But earlier this month, the McCanns warned they will sue if the book is sold in the UK. Goncalo Amaral (Photo: Mirrorpix) 
Family spokesman Clarence Mitchell said: "If Mr Amaral's current book about Madeleine or any new one he may be planning to write is published here in the UK Kate and Gerry's lawyers will take immediate action. 
"He needs to know lawyers are watching." 
Amaral was ordered to pay them €500,000 in 2015, but successfully appealed before the McCanns lost their counter-appeal at Portugal’s Supreme Court in January. 
Judges found Amaral’s “right to freedom of ­expression” was worthy of greater protection than the McCanns’ “right to honour”. 
Former GP Kate and cardiologist Gerry may keep fighting the case in the European courts. Like us on Facebook
